To mimic open water turbulence, we installed two compact axial fans (AC axial compact fan 4850 Z, ebm-papst St. Georgen GmbH & Co. KG, Georgen, Germany) set to an air flow rate of 100 m 3 h −1, as well as an aquarium pump (EHEIM compact 300, EHEIM GmbH & Co. KG, Deizisau, Germany) at a depth of 6 cm set at a rate of 150 L h −1, which resulted in a piston velocity ( k 600) of 0.44 ± 0.01 (mean ± s.d.) m d −1 ( k O2 determined in deoxygenated water, after ref.
59 ). This k 600 is typical for small lakes and ponds (0.001–0.01 km 2)
17 . The limnotrons were carefully filled with demineralized water twice a week to compensate for evaporative losses.
